message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,200,000.  It's a significant investment for you, but I believe the value it will bring to your business is well worth it.  What do you think?
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900,000. I believe that's a more reasonable price considering the product's value to me.

Bob, I appreciate your offer, but $900,000 is still a bit low for me.  How about we split the difference and settle on $1,050,000?  That's still a great deal for you, considering the value you've placed on the product.  Let's work together to make this happen.

I understand your perspective, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $950,000. I believe this is a fair compromise, considering the value I've placed on the product.

Bob, I'm willing to come down to $1,000,000.  This is a significant concession on my part, and I believe it reflects the value this product will bring to your business. Let's close this deal and move forward.

I appreciate your willingness to come down on the price, but I'm still not comfortable with $1,000,000. I'm willing to go up to $975,000, but I think that's the highest I can go. I hope we can find a mutually beneficial agreement.
Bob, I understand your position, but I can't go lower than $990,000. This is a fair compromise, considering the value this product will bring to your business. Let's close this deal and move forward.

I understand your perspective, but I'm still not comfortable with $990,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $985,000. I think this is a fair compromise, considering the value I've placed on the product.
